title.narrative: IR22: QUALITY TEACHING AND LEARNING

description.narrative: IR22: Quality of teaching and learning improved through the practice of child-centred, activity-based teaching in primary schools in at least 20 deprived districts, which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 006 : Educational Quality and Outcomes of Pre-primary and Primary Schools Improved in 5 Focus Regions

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR22: Quality of teaching and learning improved through the practice of child-centred, activity-based teaching in primary schoolsin at least 20 deprived districts

description.narrative: 4,213 teachers trained on use of school libraries and supplementary readers; and 20 reading festivals organized reaching 7,000 learners and community members. Real time data monitoring expanded to 20 districts. Innovative tool piloted in four districts to address data gap on learner performance and support results-based planning and monitoring. | Status:Met | As-of Date:21/12/2017

title.narrative: Number of focus districts where 100% of Primary Schools have trained Head teachers on leadership for Learning
Number of schools with INSET training on early grade reading teaching in the 20 focus districts.

actual.value: 2017:1,397 - 7,229 (Male-3,595, Female-3,634 includes 336: M-271, F-65 members at the district form District Teams)

title.narrative: Service Delivery - Multilingual Ed. - Classrooms provided with classroom education materials delivered in the children's mother tongue and pertinent to the children's cultural heritage - funded by UNICEF
Number of focus districts where the mSRC has been rolled out

(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) b1a. Availability of strong evidence of successful and cost-effective innovations to improve access and learning for the most disadvantaged children - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - EMIS - Training and participation of community in using Education Management Information System findings - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Innovations - Innovations to improve access and learning for the most disadvantaged children are implemented at scale and are sustainable - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Multilingual Ed. - Community engagement in multilingual / mother-tongue education - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Learning assessment - Existence of a well-functioning classroom assessment system, including for early grades - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Communities - Community (including students') participation in school management committees at primary and secondary levels - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Learning assessment - Learning outcomes are measured in all schools supported by UNICEF with Child Friendly Schools/education or similar models - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Learning assessment - Existence of a national/system-level large scale assessment, including for early grades - score (1-4), see guidance
Service Delivery - Gender - Schools that received support from UNICEF ECM programme through the child-friendly school or similar model
Service Delivery - Schools that received support from UNICEF through the child-friendly school or similar model
Service Delivery - Teachers - Primary teachers who received training with funding provided by UNICEF

Service Delivery - Communities - School management committees (or parent teacher association or school communities or similar structure) whose capacity was developed through UNICEF-supported programmes - see guidance
